newsitem.title: DUBAI: ITT Sheraton says to run more Egypt hotels.
newsitem.headline: ITT Sheraton says to run more Egypt hotels.

text.p: ITT Corp's ITT Sheraton said on Thursday it would increase the number of hotels it manages in Egypt to 10 from six by the end of next year.

"We are extremely confident about the Egyptian market. We already manage six properties in Egypt and this will increase to 10 by the end of 1998," said Manuel Garcia, ITT Sheraton Vice President and Africa and Middle East marketing director.
Garcia's comments came in a statement from ITT Sheraton during the annual Arabian Travel Market exhibition in Dubai.

The statement said the group had signed management contracts for three Egyptian hotels on the Red Sea -- the Sheraton Sharm Resort and Villas at Sharm el-Sheikh, the Sheraton Miramar, about 22 km north of Hurghada, and the Sheraton Soma Bay.
Sheraton will open the 561-room Sheraton Heliopolis Hotel in Cairo on May 10.
The hotel group also said the owners of Sheraton properties and cruise ships in Egypt were spending more than $25 million on renovations.
Some $14 million was being spent by the owners of the Cairo Sheraton. El Gezirah Sheraton Hotel's owners were spending some $6 million on renovating that hotel, also in Cairo.
